title: No, really?
author: VD
content_html:
So, the BBC is biased against Christians. And Americans. This isn’t exactly news to anyone who has ever paid attention, but at least it’s nice to see it openly admitted:

It was the day that a host of BBC executives and star presenters admitted what critics have been telling them for years: the BBC is dominated by trendy, Left-leaning liberals who are biased against Christianity and in favour of multiculturalism….

At the secret meeting in London last month, which was hosted by veteran broadcaster Sue Lawley, BBC executives admitted the corporation is dominated by homosexuals and people from ethnic minorities, deliberately promotes multiculturalism, is anti-American, anti-countryside and more sensitive to the feelings of Muslims than Christians.

And one day, if the ABCNNBCBS cabal ever admits that they are similarly biased – as Bill Clinton has already admitted – then perhaps heterosexual men might be willing to pay them some attention again.

What’s particularly annoying isn’t the bias, which has always been obvious, but the way in which tolerance is preached to leverage entry of the anchor baby, then once the gays and other subcultures are inside the gates, they begin acting upon the instutition like a metastasizing cancer.

Tolerance is a trap. Don’t tolerate it.

I don’t have a problem with biased journalism. I have a problem with subjective news that insults my intelligence by professing to be objective. I am also mystified as to why people continue to support institutions that are openly waging intellectual war against them and everything they believe.
